this is just gonna make homemade granola

we get started let's go over the

cranberries dried cranberries brown
sugar vanilla extract honey
vegetable oil cinnamon and salt now for
the nuts you can use whatever you want
for the dried fruit if you don't like
raisins and cranberries you can use
apricots you can use dry figs you can
use dates you can use whatever you want
as long as you've got the right amount
of everything play with whatever you've
got in your pantry simple as that and
the first thing we're in do is get your
oven preheated to 300 degrees you don't
want it to get really really hot because
it will burn so what else should we work

just mix this together to combine it all
that looks good I'm gonna set that aside
in this big mixing bowl here mixture
Bowl whatever you want to call it I'm

here's a quick tip I need to measure out

it's gonna come right out really really

vanilla

I'm gonna put this on a large baking

on a baking sheet it's large enough so
that you have some sort of a thin layer
you don't want to put this in like a
bundt pan or something like that this is
a 17 by 11 inch baking sheet gonna be
perfect now I'm gonna put this into the
oven at 300 for about 40 minutes or so
but every 15 minutes every 10 to 15
minutes I'm gonna come in and kind of
mix it all together because I want to
make sure everything it's nicely browned
and crisped up but nothing burns so
don't let it cool and that's it I'm
gonna show you last step before we eat
it my granola was in the oven for about
40 minutes and I every 10 to 15 minutes
I went in with my one spoon and just mix
it around now remember one thing after
forty minutes you're gonna still gonna
be really soft but as it cools it's
gonna harden now I've taken mine out of
the oven about five minutes ago and it's
really starting to hardening up now but
